Portions of north central Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued June 17 at 1:24PM MDT until June 17 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * WHERE...Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...Through 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 17 at 5:12AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm temperatures will continue through the weekend. These temperatures, combined with windy conditions, will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt once again. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will likely reach high levels again. Currently only bankfull conditions (Action Stage) to minor low-land flooding (Minor Stage Flooding) is
